usually disapproving unreasonably determined, especially to act in a particular way and not to change at all, despite what anyone else says: He can be very obstinate at times. her obstinate refusal to compromise

[ before noun ] used to describe a problem, situation, or thing that is difficult to deal with, remove, change, or defeat: obstinate weeds Invading troops met with obstinate resistance by guerrilla forces.
